field.label: Enable HAProxy
field.help: Enable or disable the HAProxy service.

field.label: Graceful stop
field.help: Enable HAProxy's graceful stop mode. In this mode HAProxy will continue to process existing connections until they close. Note that this may severely slow down HAProxy's shutdown, depending on the configured timeout values. If graceful stop mode is not enabled, HAProxy will use the hard stop mode where it immediately quits and all established connections are closed. Hard stop mode is recommended.

field.label: Seamless reload
field.help: HAProxy will handle service restarts in a way that no connections are dropped. This is the best restart mode, because it has no impact on user experience. That being said, there might be edge cases where seamless reloads lead to unexpected behaviour.

field.label: Show introduction pages
field.help: Uncheck to hide all additional introduction pages. Requires a manual page reload for the change to take effect.

field.label: Enable peers
field.help: Enable or disable HAProxy peers. This will propagate entries of any data-types in stick-tables between several HAProxy instances over TCP connections in a multi-master fashion.

field.label: Peer name (FQDN)
field.help: The name of the peer. This is usually the full hostname to make it possible for HAProxy to recognize the local peer. If HAProxy is unable to find the local peer it will fail to start.

field.label: Listen address (IP)
field.help: The listen address of the local peer or the address of the remote peer.

field.label: TCP Port
field.help: The TCP port that should be used for connections to this peer. It must not be used by any other service.

Run as root
field.help:
Enable or disable HAProxy running as root.
NOTE: Enabling root could be a security issue but it's required by some feature.

field.label: HAProxy processes
field.help:
Number of HAProxy processes to start.
NOTE: You may experience random issues in multi-process mode. For more information about the "nbproc" option please see the HAProxy Documentation.

field.label: HAProxy threads
field.help: Number of threads to create for each HAProxy process.

field.label: Maximum connections
field.help:
Sets the maximum number of concurrent connections per HAProxy process.
NOTE: HAProxy will not be able to allocate enough memory if you set this value too high. Consider raising the settings for kern.maxfiles and kern.maxfilesperproc if you need to specify a non-default value.

field.label: Verify SSL Server Certificates
field.help: This enforces a certain behavior for SSL verify on servers, ignoring per-server settings. If set to 'enforce verify', server certificates are verified. If set to 'disable verify', server certificates are not verified. The default is 'no preference' to only use per-server configurations and not enforce a global default for all servers.

field.label: Maximum SSL DH Size
field.help:
Sets the maximum size of the Diffie-Hellman parameters used for generating the ephemeral/temporary Diffie-Hellman key in case of DHE key exchange (default is 1024).
NOTE: Higher values will increase the CPU load. For more information about the "tune.ssl.default-dh-param" option please see the HAProxy Documentation.

field.label: Buffer size
field.help:
Change the buffer size (in bytes). Lower values allow more sessions to coexist in the same amount of RAM, and higher values allow some applications with very large cookies to work. The default value is 16384.
NOTE: It is strongly recommended not to change this from the default value, as very low values will break some services such as statistics, and values larger than default size will increase memory usage, possibly causing the system to run out of memory.

field.label: Health check buffer size
field.help: Change the check buffer size (in bytes). Higher values may help find string or regex patterns in very large pages, though doing so may imply more memory and CPU usage. The default value is 16384.

field.label: Maximum RAM per LUA process
field.help: Sets the maximum amount of RAM in megabytes per process usable by Lua. By default it is zero which means unlimited. It is important to set a limit to ensure that a bug in a script will not result in the system running out of memory.

field.label: Spread checks
field.help: Add some randomness in the check interval between 0 and +/- 50%. A value between 2 and 5 seems to show good results. The default value is 0 (disabled).

field.label: Custom options
field.help:
These lines will be added to the global settings of to the HAProxy configuration file.
NOTE: The syntax will not be checked, use at your own risk!

field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable global SSL default values.

field.label: Bind options
field.help: Used to enforce or disable certain SSL options.

field.label: Cipher List
field.help: It sets the default string describing the list of cipher algorithms ("cipher suite") that are negotiated during the SSL/TLS handshake.

field.label: NOTE: Define default parameters for ALL Public Services, Backend Pools and Servers here. They may still be overriden elsewhere.
Max. Connections
field.help: Set the maximum number of concurrent connections for this frontend.

field.label: Client Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the client side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Connection Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum time to wait for a connection attempt to a server to succeed. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Check Timeout
field.help: Sets an additional read timeout for running health checks on a server. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Server Timeout
field.help: Set the maximum inactivity time on the server side. Defaults to milliseconds. Optionally the unit may be specified as either "d", "h", "m", "s", "ms" or "us".

field.label: Retries
field.help: Set the number of retries to perform on a server after a connection failure (default is 3).

field.label: Session redistribution
field.help: Enable or disable session redistribution in case of connection failure.

field.label: Custom options
field.help:
These lines will be added to the defaults settings of to the HAProxy configuration file.
NOTE: The syntax will not be checked, use at your own risk!

field.label: Log Host
field.help: Indicates where to send the logs. Takes an IPv4 or IPv6 address optionally followed by a colon (':') and a UDP port, i.e. 127.0.0.1 or 10.0.0.1:514

field.label: Syslog facility
field.help: Choose one of the 24 standard syslog facilities. The default value is local0.

field.label: Filter syslog level
field.help: Can be specified to filter outgoing messages. By default, all messages are sent. If a level is specified, only messages with a severity at least as important as this level will be sent.

field.label: Max. line length
field.help: Specify an optional maximum line length in characters. Log lines larger than this value will be truncated before being sent. The reason is that syslog servers act differently on log line length. All servers support the default value of 1024 characters, but some servers simply drop larger lines while others do log them.

field.label: Stats enabled
field.help: Enable HAProxy's statistics page.

field.label: Local stats TCP port
field.help: Choose a TCP port to be used for the local statistics page. The default value is 8822.

field.label: Enable remote access
field.help: Enable remote access to HAProxy's statistics page. This may be a security risk if you do not enable authentication! Note that you need to add appropiate firewall rules for this to work.

field.label: Remote listen addresses
field.help: Configure listen addresses for the statistics page to enable remote access, i.e. 10.0.0.1:8080 or haproxy.example.com:8999. Use TAB key to complete typing a listen address.
field.hint: Enter address:port here. Finish with TAB.

field.label: Allowed Users
field.hint: Type username or choose from list.

field.label: Allowed Groups
field.hint: Type group or choose from list.
